Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Shediac is a charming seaside fishing town in New Brunswick. With a growing tourism industry and strong resource sector, the town remains an important hub for the surrounding communities. The town is home to the popular Parlee Beach and hosts the annual New Brunswick Lobster Festival. One of the area’s important exports is lobster and the local market has a vibrant industry providing significant economic contribution to the community. The lobster exportation industry is responsible for more than 800 million dollars in annual revenue in New Brunswick. Shediac’s commercial businesses are supported by the town’s ± 6,000 population and the larger trade area of ± 14,000people within a 10km radius (2020, Sitewise).

Shediac is a charming seaside fishing town in New Brunswick. With a growing tourism industry and strong resource sector, the town remains an important hub for the surrounding communities. The town is home to the popular Parlee Beach and hosts the annual New Brunswick Lobster Festival. One of the area’s important exports is lobster and the local market has a vibrant industry providing significant economic contribution to the community. The lobster exportation industry is responsible for more than 800 million dollars in annual revenue in New Brunswick. Shediac’s commercial businesses are supported by the town’s ± 6,000 population and the larger trade area of ± 14,000people within a 10km radius (2020, Sitewise).

The plaza is populated with premier tenants, the majority of which are national brands. The offering consists of 6 retailers, 3 office users, totaling 31,241 sq.ft. of gross leasable area. The center is 71% leased, with vacancy consisting of 9,180 SF providing investors the opportunity to increase NOI while still receiving a stable income stream. The property is advantageously located off the heavily traveled Paul Street (45,000 VPD) and off busy Champlain Street (77,000 VPD) as well as minutes from Highway 15. The site’s ease of access and visibility provides large volumes of traffic and interception points over other centers in the area including CF Champlain, New Brunswick’s largest Shopping Center. The property was originally built in 1975, before being extensively redeveloped in 1990.

Shippagan is a charming seaside fishing town on the Acadian Peninsula in New Brunswick. With a growing tourism industry and strong resource sector, the town remains an important hub for the surrounding communities. The town is home to the New Brunswick Aquarium and Marine Centre and hosts the annual New Brunswick Fisheries and Aquaculture Festival. One of the area’s important exports is peat moss and the local market has a vibrant industry (and provincial peat moss festival) providing significant economic contribution to the community. The peat industry is responsible for $100 - $150 million in annual revenue. Shippagan’s commercial businesses are supported by the town’s ±4,285 population and the larger trade area of ±28,252 people (2018, Sitewise). See Flyer for more details!

Anchored by Shoppers Drug Mart, Independent Grocer (Loblaws), National Bank and Rossy, 229 & 231 J.D. Gauthier Boulevard is the main shopping destination in Shippagan. As the key grocery and pharmacy location in the community, this is an excellent investment opportunity to secure a position in this hub town. The offering includes two buildings, the main retail plaza of 229 J.D. Gauthier and a standalone café (Tazza) building at 231 J.D. Gauthier.

An Appealing property for owners looking for a commercial property in downtown. This one level building will appeal to a number of businesses and professionals. The property is also supported by City Centre Zoning (CC) which permits a wide variety of uses. Current design is best suited for a medical practice or other health based professionals. The building is about 2,000 Square Feet and Parking is available on site. See flyer for more information!

The building is 35,518 SF was constructed in 1983,then expanded in 1988 and 1993. The foundation is a concrete slab with the exterior of the building comprising of brick masonry on the front with steel panels on the other three walls. The roof is modified stacking seam and modified bitumen. Which was redone in 2018. For Loading access, the property has to dock level doors with and additional bay door at grade level with a lift. In addition to the roof, significant upgrades have been completed to support a Multi-tenant property that appeals to variety of Tenants. These upgrades include, sprinkler, fire alarm, Roof, Ventilation and lighting. Currently the property is fully leased. Rent Rolland Property Expense can be made available upon execution of a Confidentiality Agreement.
